topics.title: Severe Bleeding: Control It Fast
topics.summary: Direct pressure, pack if needed, then tourniquet if life-threatening.
steps: Use clean cloth or any available fabric. Apply firm, direct pressure on the wound. Do not remove soaked cloth—add more on top.
If bleeding continues and the wound is deep, pack the wound firmly with cloth/gauze while keeping pressure.
If an arm/leg is still bleeding heavily, apply a tourniquet 2–3 inches above the wound (not over a joint). Tighten until bleeding stops.
Keep the person warm and still. Seek emergency help as soon as possible.

topics.title: CPR (Adults): Hands-Only
topics.summary: Push hard and fast in the center of the chest.
steps: Check responsiveness and breathing. If not breathing normally, call emergency services (use speakerphone).
Place the heel of your hand in the center of the chest, other hand on top, arms straight.
Push hard and fast (~100–120/min), allowing full recoil. Keep going until help arrives or an AED is available.
If trained and willing, give rescue breaths (30 compressions : 2 breaths). Otherwise, continue hands-only.

topics.title: Anxiety: 5-4-3-2-1 Grounding
topics.summary: Orient to the present with your senses + steady breathing.
steps: Breathe in for 4, hold 2, out for 6. Repeat.
Notice 1 thing you can taste. Breathe slowly again.

topics.title: Safe Water: Boil Method
topics.summary: Bring water to a rolling boil for at least 1 minute (3 minutes at high altitude).
steps: Filter cloudy water through clean cloth if needed.
Bring to a rolling boil for 1 full minute (3 minutes if above ~6,500 ft / 2,000 m).
Let it cool and store covered in a clean container.
